title: Gourd-shaped vase with Indian lotus decoration in wucai painted enamels
author: Unknown
description: The 'passionflower' is an exotic botanical motif derived from a hybrid design combining Indian lotus and Persian floral elements. The pattern layout features symmetrical floral motifs, clearly influenced by Islamic decorative art.

title: Blue-and-white dish with floral cartouche and bird design
author: Unknown
description: The dish has a flared rim, shallow sides, a sunken center, and a ring foot. It is fully decorated in underglaze blue. In the center is a design of flowers and birds.

title: Bowl with "presenting the treasure" motif in doucai painted enamels
author: Unknown
description: Decorated in the typical Ming-dynasty doucai technique, this piece features bright, richly layered colors. The exterior is adorned with auspicious 'Jinbao' motifs.

title: Bowl decorated with flowers of the four seasons in yangcai painted enamels
author: Unknown
description: The exterior is adorned with multicolored floral designs, including peonies, peony-rose, chrysanthemums, and other blossoms; both the flowers and foliage are outlined in red and black enamels.

title: Tea bowl with floral scroll on a black ground in falangcai painted enamels
author: Unknown
description: The exterior features a black ground with enamel-painted peonies, exotic lotuses, and other entwined seasonal flowers as the main motifs.

title: Vase with figure, flower and bird decoration in yangcai painted enamels
author: Unknown
description: Polychrome decoration depicts sloping ground with light grasses, peach and willow trees with spring swallows, and a farmer with a child herding animals.

title: Underglaze-blue porcelain snuff bottle with a landscape-and-figure design
author: Unknown
description: Bottle-shaped, with a straight mouth, short neck, cylindrical body. Features a blue-and-white depiction of a man fishing beneath a pine tree before a cliff.

title: Bencharong Covered Bowl (Lai Nam Thong style)
author: Unknown
description: Porcelain covered bowl decorated in the Lai Nam Thong style of Chinese export ware made for the Thai market. Painted with enamel colours: turquoise, red and gold.

title: Yellow-Ground Famille Rose Rectangular Planter with Lotus Designs
author: Unknown
description: Rectangular planter with a flat mouth. The exterior features famille rose decoration on a pale yellow ground. The four sides depict a continuous lotus pond scene.

title: Flambé Glazed Apricot Medallion Vase
author: Unknown
description: Rectangular vase with symmetrical tubular handles. Covered overall in flambé glaze. The late Qing flambé glazes were predominantly red with intermingling black patches.

title: Famille Rose Vase Depicting Mulan's Homecoming
author: Wang Dafan
description: Painted using traditional overglaze enamels. The scene vividly depicts Mulan's triumphant return and her family's joy, derived from the 'Ballad of Mulan'.

title: China-Albania Friendship Porcelain Sculpture
author: Unknown
description: Sculpted using traditional round carving techniques. It depicts Chinese and Albanian youths holding the 'Little Red Book' and singing praises.

title: Five Storey's: Chinese Ladders 3
author: Felicity Aylieff
description: Monumental blue-and-white porcelain sculpture created in collaboration with Jingdezhen 'Big Ware' master potters.

title: Narrative Ceramics Installation (GIRINO / IL CANTANTE...)
author: ELICA Studio
description: Four-piece porcelain installation blending Italian 'istoriato' narrative ceramics with contemporary Jingdezhen exchanges.

title: Nine Cranes Dancing
author: Ma Jun
description: Record-breaking thin-body porcelain bowl created using 'fen shui' (water separation) and semi-carving techniques.

title: 'March' - Porcelain - Physical NFT
author: Wang Wei Ping
description: Jingdezhen porcelain vessel later minted as a Physical NFT on ArtAreas.io; connected to the digital token through an NFC chip.

title: Weapons of Choice
author: FuturePunk
description: A digital artwork rendering weapons using ceramic-like textures and reflective digital surfaces.

title: Hermes
author: Uwe Heine Debrodt
description: Physical Raku-fired sculpture transformed into a digital animated NFT through 3D scanning.
